@logging_to_appins
def validate_parameters(storage_acc, raw_container, raw_source_folder, raw_name, standardised_container, standardised_source_folder, standardised_name, linked_service, sheet_name=0, header_row=0):
    
    ''' 
    Type check the parameters that will be used in the ETL processing with pyspark in subsequent functions    

    Args:

    Returns:

    Actions:
    
    Raises:
     '''
    
    ### imports
    from notebookutils import mssparkutils
    
    ### creating filepath
    filepath = raw_container + raw_source_folder + raw_name

    ### checking abfss path
    if filepath.split('abfss://')[0] != '':
        raise ValueError("File path string is not of abfss:// type")
        
    
    ### checking filepath has xlsx file in it 

    ### checking str data types
    # defining parameters to check
    parameters = {
        'filepath':filepath,
        'storage_acc':storage_acc,
        'linked_service':linked_service
    }

    # checking str type
    str_errors = ''
    for para in parameters:
        if type(parameters[para]) != str:
            str_errors += para
        if str_errors != '':
            raise TypeError(f"Parameters: {str_errors} not of type string")   
            
    # checking sheet name type is str or int
    if type(sheet_name) != str and type(sheet_name) != int:
        raise TypeError("Sheet name should either be a string or a integer")
        
    # checking int type
    if type(header_row) != int:
        raise TypeError("Header row should be an integer value")

@logging_to_appins
def _cleanse_headers(df):
    '''
    NOT A PURE FUNCTION
    Take a dataframe and appropriately cleanse headers in a file
    '''
    ### imports
    import pandas as pd
    import re

    ### type checks
    if not isinstance(df, pd.DataFrame):
        raise TypeError("Expecting a pandas dataframe")
        
    cols = df.columns
    cols=[re.sub("( |\#|\# |\.|\(|\)|\/)","_",i) for i in cols] # replace chars with _
    cols=[re.sub("([\_]{2,})","_",i) for i in cols] #replace consecutive _ with one _
    cols=[re.sub("(\_)$","",i) for i in cols] #remove trailing _
    cols = [item.replace(',','') for item in cols]
    df.columns = cols

    return df 

@logging_to_appins
def _change_types(df):
    '''
    NOT A PURE FUNCTION
    Take a dataframe and appropriately make all data types a string
    '''

    ### imports
    import pandas as pd
    
    ### type checks
    if not isinstance(df, pd.DataFrame):
        raise TypeError("Expecting a pandas dataframe")
        
    return df.astype(str, errors='ignore')

@logging_to_appins
def ingest_excel_to_parquet(storage_acc, raw_container, raw_source_folder, raw_name, standardised_container, standardised_source_folder, standardised_name, linked_service, sheet_name=0, header=0):

    '''
    Create a parquet file with delta capabilities from a source excel file
    '''

    ### initialising spark session
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()

    ### setting appopriate spark variables
    source_full_storage_account_name = storage_acc
    spark.conf.set(f"spark.storage.synapse.{source_full_storage_account_name}.linkedServiceName", linked_service )
    spark.conf.set(f"fs.azure.account.oauth.provider.type.{source_full_storage_account_name}", "com.microsoft.azure.synapse.tokenlibrary.LinkedServiceBasedTokenProvider")

    ### creating targetpath variable
    filepath = raw_container + raw_source_folder + raw_name
    targetpath = standardised_container + standardised_source_folder + standardised_name

    ### reading file with abfss file location format
    import pandas as pd
    from notebookutils import mssparkutils
    jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()

    mount_storage(path=raw_container + raw_source_folder)
    df = pd.read_excel(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{raw_name}", sheet_name=sheet_name, header=header, dtype='object')
    unmount_storage()
    ### cleanse headers 
    df = _cleanse_headers(df)
    
    ### change all types to string
    df = _change_types(df)

    ### writing output
    logInfo(f"Writing to {targetpath}")
    df.to_parquet(targetpath)
    logInfo(f"Written to {targetpath}")

@logging_to_appins
def ingest_adhoc(storage_account, 
                    definition,
                    folder_path, 
                    filename, 
                    expected_from, 
                    expected_to, 
                    isMultilineJSON=False, 
                    dataAttribute=None):

    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    from notebookutils import mssparkutils
    import json
    from datetime import datetime, timedelta, date
    import pandas as pd
    from pyspark.sql.types import StringType,DateType,TimestampType,IntegerType, FloatType, StructType
    import re
    from pyspark.sql.functions import col, lit
    import pyspark.sql.types as types

    ingestion_failure: bool = False

    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    spark.conf.set("spark.databricks.delta.schema.autoMerge.enabled", "true")

    standardised_container = "abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_account
    standardised_path = definition['Standardised_Path'] + "/"
    standardised_table_name = definition['zzz_test_{definition['Standardised_Table_Name']}"

    if 'Standardised_Table_Definition' in definition:
        standardised_table_loc = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_account + definition['Standardised_Table_Definition']
        standardised_table_def_json = spark.read.text(standardised_table_loc, wholetext=True).first().value
    else:
        standardised_table_def_json = mssparkutils.notebook.run('/py_get_schema_from_url', 30, {'db_name': 'odw_standardised_db', 'entity_name': definition['Source_Frequency_Folder']})
 
    if not any([table.name == standardised_table_name for table in spark.catalog.listTables('odw_standardised_db')]):
        create_table_from_schema(standardised_table_def_json, "odw_standardised_db", standardised_table_name,standardised_container , standardised_path+standardised_table_name)   

    #Check that we're dealing with delta already. If not we will convert the table first
    table_metadata = spark.sql(f"DESCRIBE EXTENDED odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")
    data_format = table_metadata.filter(table_metadata.col_name == "Provider").collect()[0].data_type

    if data_format == "parquet":
        replace = spark.sql(f"SELECT * FROM odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")
        replace.write.option("mergeSchema", "true").format("delta").mode("overwrite").saveAsTable(f"odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}_new")

        # Drop the original table
        spark.sql(f"DROP TABLE IF EXISTS odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")
		
        # Rename the temporary table to replace the original table
        spark.sql(f"ALTER TABLE odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}_new RENAME TO odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")

    try:
        standardised_table_location = spark.sql(f"DESCRIBE FORMATTED odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}") \
                    .filter("col_name = 'Location'") \
                    .select("data_type") \
                    .collect()[0][0] 
    except:
        standardised_table_location = standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name
                   
    standardised_table_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_table_location)
    rows = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == expected_from) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == expected_to)).count()

    jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
    ### mount the data lake storage in Synapse to the Synapse File Mount API 
    mount_storage(path=folder_path)

    logInfo(f"Reading {filename}")

    ### open .csv and .xlsx files using pandas                                 
    if ".xlsx" in filename.lower():
        sheet_name = definition['Source_Sheet_Name'] if 'Source_Sheet_Name' in definition else 0
        df = pd.read_excel(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", dtype=str, sheet_name=sheet_name, na_filter=False)
    elif '.csv' in filename.lower():
        df = spark.read.options(quote='"', escape='\\', encoding='utf8', header=True, multiLine=True, columnNameOfCorruptRecord='corrupted_records', mode="PERMISSIVE").csv(f"{folder_path}/{filename}")

        if "corrupted_records" in df.columns:
            print(f"Corrupted Records detected from CSV ingestion in {filename}")
            ingestion_failure = True
            

    elif '.json' in filename.lower():
        if isMultilineJSON == False:
            df = spark.read.json(f"{folder_path}/{filename}")
        else:
            logInfo("Reading multiline JSON")
            df = spark.read.option("multiline", "true").json(f"{folder_path}/{filename}")

            #we need to pull the data from a specific data attribute
            if dataAttribute:
                dfs: list = [] # an empty list to store the data frames
                for row in df.select(dataAttribute).collect():
                    for data in row[dataAttribute]:
                        dfs.append(data)
                df = spark.createDataFrame(dfs)
    else:
        raise RuntimeError(f"This file type for {filename} is unsupported")

    ### drop headerless columns
    sparkDF = df.select([col for col in df.columns if not col.startswith('Unnamed')])
    # rows_raw = len(df.index)
    rows_raw = sparkDF.count()
    unmount_storage()
    ### add date columns included with every standardised table
    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("ingested_datetime",lit(datetime.now()))
    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_from",lit(expected_from))
    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_to",lit(expected_to))
    ## add extra log columns here


    ### change any array field to string
    schema = json.loads(standardised_table_def_json)
    for field in schema['fields']:
        if field['type'] == 'array':
            field['type'] = 'string'
    schema = StructType.fromJson(schema)

    ### remove characters that Delta can't allow in headers and add numbers to repeated column headers
    cols_orig = sparkDF.schema.names
    cols=[re.sub('[^0-9a-zA-Z]+', '_', i).lower() for i in cols_orig]
    cols=[colm.rstrip('_') for colm in cols]
    newlist = []
    for i, v in enumerate(cols):
        totalcount = cols.count(v)
        count = cols[:i].count(v)
        newlist.append(v + str(count + 1) if totalcount > 1 else v)
    for colix in range(len(cols_orig)):
        sparkDF = sparkDF.toDF(*newlist) 

    ### Cast any column in sparkDF with type mismatch
    for field in sparkDF.schema:
        table_field = next((f for f in schema if f.name.lower() == field.name.lower()), None)
        if table_field is not None and field.dataType != table_field.dataType:
            sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn(field.name, col(field.name).cast(table_field.dataType))

    ### writing the dataframe to the existing standardised table
    logInfo(f"Writing data to odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")
    sparkDF.write.option("mergeSchema", "true").format("delta").mode("append").saveAsTable(f"odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")
    logInfo(f"Written data to odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")
    
    standardised_table_df_new = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_table_location)
    rows_new = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == expected_from) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == expected_to)).count()

    ### test correct number of rows have written
    if rows_raw <= rows_new:
        #count up the rows which match the dates, we should at LEAST have those, multiple runs on the same day will lead to the counts not matching however
        logInfo('All rows have successfully been written')
    else:
        logError(f"All rows have NOT been successfully written. Expected {rows_raw} but {rows_new} written")
        ingestion_failure = True
    return (ingestion_failure, rows_raw)
